DataElement.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Gastrointestinal System Ulcer Symptoms Interfere with Life 3 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much ulcers (of the digestive system) interferes with their activities, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Gastrointestinal System Ulcer Symptoms Interfere with Life
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function._A question about whether an individual currently has a disease._The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas._A circumscribed inflammatory and often suppurating lesion on the skin or an internal mucous surface resulting in necrosis of tissue._A question about an individual's feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Concepts.longName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
Concepts.definition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Property.preferredName: Have Current Illness Gastrointestinal System Ulcer Symptoms Interfere with Life
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.:The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.:A circumscribed inflammatory and often suppurating lesion on the skin or an internal mucous surface resulting in necrosis of tissue.:A question about an individual's feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.
The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.
A circumscribed inflammatory and often suppurating lesion on the skin or an internal mucous surface resulting in necrosis of tissue.
A question about an individual feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
